text-align: center;"><b>4 Phases</b></span></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="500" width="550" x="10" y="40" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-7" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-6" style="text;strokeColor=default;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;spacingLeft=4;spacingRight=4;overflow=hidden;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;rotatable=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" value="<div><b>PHASE 1) INTENT CLASSIFICATION:</b></div><div>- A<span style="background-color: transparent;">nalyzes prompt via LLM<br></span><span style="background-color: transparent;">- Check params.category → Match prompt catalog → Apply classify_intent()</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">:</span></div><div><div>&nbsp; - CHAT - Conversational responses</div><div>&nbsp; - GRAPH - Analytics, NL-&gt;Cypher queries</div><div>&nbsp; - SECURITY - Security/permissions questions</div><div>&nbsp; - ADMIN - Administrative write operations</div><div>&nbsp; - DANGEROUS - Destructive ops → refuse + offer EXPLAIN</div><div>&nbsp; - EXPLAIN - EXPLAIN-only query analysis</div></div><div><br></div><div><span style="background-color: transparent;"><b>PHASE 2) TODO Planning</b></span><b>&nbsp;(multi-step run):</b></div><div><div style="">- LLM-based planning</div><div style="">- Input: Goal + Context + Schema → Output: TODO Array</div><div style="">- Planning Modes: full (LLM per TODO) | optional (try direct) | none (deterministic)</div></div><div style=""><br></div><div><div><b>PHASE 3) Step Execution,&nbsp;<span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">FOR EACH TODO</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">:</span></b></div><div>&nbsp; 1. Call LLM Provider (planner, reflector, responder)</div><div>&nbsp; 2. Invoke MCP Tools with RBAC check (34 tools available)</div><div>&nbsp; 3. If GRAPH mode: NL-&gt;Cypher pipeline</div><div>&nbsp; 4. Persist step → PostgreSQL&nbsp;<span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">(via adaptor)</span></div><div>&nbsp; 5. Use Redis for session/cache/cancel&nbsp;<span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">(via adaptor)</span></div><div>- Step records: {id, action, input, output, latency_ms, started_at, finished_at}</div></div><div><br></div><div><div><b>PHASE 4)&nbsp;</b><b style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">Finalization &amp;&nbsp;</b><b style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">Response Generation</b></div><div><div>- build_response() → Orchestration Result</div><div>- Response mode selection: fallback-only | llm-best-effort</div><div>- Canonical output structure: {goal, steps[], outputs[], todos[], metrics}</div><div>- Normalize final output: text + optional JSON payload</div><div>- Safety/compliance: PII scrubbing + output guard checks</div><div>- Persist final state + metrics → PostgreSQL</div><div>- Observability: emit Prometheus metrics + OpenTelemetry traces</div></div></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="470" width="550" y="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-8" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-5" style="swimlane;fontStyle=0;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;startSize=30;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeParentMax=0;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1;marginBottom=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#FFF2CC;strokeColor=default;" value="<div style="text-align: left;"><b>ADDITIONAL SERVICES</b></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="120" width="550" x="10" y="560" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-9" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-8" style="text;strokeColor=default;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;spacingLeft=4;spacingRight=4;overflow=hidden;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;rotatable=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" value="<div><span style="background-color: transparent; Auth JWT - JWT/OIDC token validation and principal extraction</b></div></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="110" width="910" x="10" y="240" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-16" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-15" style="text;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;spacingLeft=4;spacingRight=4;overflow=hidden;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;rotatable=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;strokeColor=default;" value="<div>- Validates Bearer token via JWKS endpoint (RS256/RS384/RS512)</div><div>- Extracts claims: sub, tenant_id, roles[], scopes[], exp, iat</div><div><div>- RBAC &amp; Scope Enforcement for endpoints</div></div><div>- Builds Principal object for downstream authorization</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- Rejects expired/invalid/malformed tokens with 401 Unauthorized</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="80" width="910" y="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-17" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-10" style="swimlane;fontStyle=0;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;startSize=30;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeParentMax=0;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1;marginBottom=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=center;fillColor=#FFE9E9;strokeColor=default;" value="<div style=""><div><b>4. Rate Limit - Redis-backed rate limiting with multiple dimensions</b></div></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="110" width="910" x="10" y="470" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-18" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-17" style="text;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;spacingLeft=4;spacingRight=4;overflow=hidden;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;rotatable=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;strokeColor=default;" value="<div>- Per-user limits: ratelimit:user:{sub}</div><div>- Per-tenant limits: ratelimit:tenant:{tenant_id}</div><div>- Per-endpoint limits: ratelimit:endpoint:{method}:{path}</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- Sliding window algorithm, returns 429 Too Many Requests when exceeded</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset headers</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="80" width="910" y="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-19" parent="EiYPZZWAnG0CHaq9ObTb-10" style="swimlane;fontStyle=0;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;startSize=30;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeParentMax=0;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1;marginBottom=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=center;fillColor=#FFE9E9;strokeColor=default;" value="<div style=""><div><b>5. value="<div>JOB CREATION FLOW:</div><div>- Validate job request (Pydantic schema)</div><div>- Validate payload against JSON Schema for job type</div><div>- Check idempotency key (Redis + PostgreSQL)</div><div>- Create Job record (status=queued) → PostgreSQL</div><div>- LPUSH job_id → Redis queue: jobs:queue:{type}</div><div>- HSET job state → Redis: jobs:state:{id}</div><div>- Cache idempotency mapping → Redis</div><div>- Return HTTP 202 + JobResponse {id, status, created_at} + Location header</div><div>- Job Types: demo, test, long-running, agent.run</div><div><br></div><div>Redis Queue (Job IDs) → To Workers via BRPOP</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="180" width="570" y="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell value="<div>WORKER PROCESSING LOOP FOR EACH JOB:</div><div>1. Pop job ID: BRPOP jobs:queue:{type} (blocking wait)</div><div>2. Load job metadata from PostgreSQL</div><div>3. Check pre-execution cancellation flag (Redis)</div><div>4. Update status: queued → running</div><div>5. Append status event to job_events table</div><div>6. Start async heartbeat task</div><div>7. Execute handler (uses same adapters: Memgraph, LLM, Redis):</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- demo jobs: simple demonstration</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- test jobs: testing purposes</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- long-running jobs: extended analysis</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp;- agent.run jobs: async agent execution (orchestrator integration)</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Load/Create AgentRun record → PostgreSQL</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Update AgentRun status: queued → running</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Emit SSE: agent_run_started</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Initialize Orchestrator.from_env()</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Emit SSE: orchestrator_init</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Execute orchestrator.run() with timeout</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• LLM calls, MCP tools, Graph queries</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Persist steps per-step → PostgreSQL</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Session state → Redis</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Check cancellation between steps</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Emit progress events per orchestration step</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Apply PII scrubbing &amp; output guard</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Emit agent-specific Prometheus metrics</div><div>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;• Update AgentRun status → succeeded | failed</div><div>8. Periodically check cancellation flags (Redis: jobs:cancel:{id})</div><div>9. Emit progress events → RPUSH jobs:events:{id} → SSE to Control Panel</div><div>10. On completion: status = finished | failed | cancelled</div><div>11. Persist result → PostgreSQL</div><div>12. Append terminal event to job_events</div><div><br></div><div>Job Status State Machine: queued → running → finished | failed | cancelled</div><div><br></div><div>Resources: 2 CPU, 4GB RAM</div><div>Uses same adapters/services as main app (shared codebase)</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="530" width="550" y="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="jL9Ayfw5SwNCbvacDRDm-60" parent="1" style="swimlane;fontStyle=0;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;startSize=30;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeParentMax=0;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1;marginBottom=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#DAE4E6;strokeColor=default;" value="<div style="text-align: left;"><div><b style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">PHASE 4)&nbsp;</b><b>Long-Running Job Completion</b></div></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="120" width="930" x="610" y="3045" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="jL9Ayfw5SwNCbvacDRDm-61" parent="jL9Ayfw5SwNCbvacDRDm-60" style="text;strokeColor=default;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;spacingLeft=4;spacingRight=4;overflow=hidden;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;rotatable=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" value="<div>- State machine: queued → running → finished | failed | cancelled</div><div>- Persist job status → PostgreSQL</div><div>- Append progress/state events → job_events table</div><div>- Progress event format: {stage, message, percent}</div><div>- Stream updates via SSE to Control Panel (heartbeat keep-alive)</div><div>- Emit and persist terminal status: finished | failed | cancelled</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="90" width="930" y="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

div.div:
- Analyzes prompt via LLM
- Check params.category → Match prompt catalog → Apply classify_intent():
- DANGEROUS - Destructive ops → refuse + offer EXPLAIN
- Input: Goal + Context + Schema → Output: TODO Array
- Planning Modes: full (LLM per TODO) | optional (try direct) | none (deterministic)

div.b: PHASE 3) Step Execution, FOR EACH TODO:

div.div: 2. Invoke MCP Tools with RBAC check (34 tools available)
- Step records: {id, action, input, output, latency_ms, started_at, finished_at}
- Canonical output structure: {goal, steps[], outputs[], todos[], metrics}
- Normalize final output: text + optional JSON payload
- Safety/compliance: PII scrubbing + output guard checks
- Observability: emit Prometheus metrics + OpenTelemetry traces

2. Generate Cypher → LLM-based or test hints

5. Summarize Results → convert graph results to natural language

- Cleanup (hourly): stale/old sessions, expired/stale cache, expired jobs, old job records, orphan runs
- Backup (daily): PostgreSQL dump, Redis RDB snapshot, Memgraph archives, audit logs export
- Provider monitoring: provider health + metrics emission

div.div: WORKER PROCESSING LOOP FOR EACH JOB:
1. Pop job ID: BRPOP jobs:queue:{type} (blocking wait)
5. Append status event to job_events table
7. Execute handler (uses same adapters: Memgraph, LLM, Redis):
- agent.run jobs: async agent execution (orchestrator integration)
• LLM calls, MCP tools, Graph queries
• Emit progress events per orchestration step
9. Emit progress events → RPUSH jobs:events:{id} → SSE to Control Panel
10. On completion: status = finished | failed | cancelled
Job Status State Machine: queued → running → finished | failed | cancelled
Uses same adapters/services as main app (shared codebase)

switch.text: WORKER PROCESSING LOOP FOR EACH JOB:...
